comments:
I'm not sure where this problem truely resides ... but when I tried testing the 
Callisto Update Site for M5, currently at 

http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/staging/

The c++ stuff downloaded for a while, then said "couldn't find jdt.apt.core" (or similar). 

I *was* using JRE 1.4.2 (both, when trying to on install C++, and when I previously installed JDT ... from update site ... I started with only the platform runtime binary (from a zip file), which is probably a critical part of reproducing this ... since if JDT installed from a zip, I'm sure it would contain the jdt.apt plugins).

So .. does CDT firmly *require* JRE 1.5 (and JDT APT)? Or ... was the some 
"requires" incorrectly stated? Could it be 'optional'?

Hmm, I tried again running under JRE 1.5, and didn't see the APT error, but ... saw another ... pasted below. Have I not copied some requirement correctly? 

(I hope the APT error was't a red-herring). Also ... I think this "staging" copy 
came from running the Update's ant task "mirror", from a linux command line ... I hope its a true "mirror everything" and doesn't just pick up linux pre reqs!). 



!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.core 4 0 2006-03-06 00:34:37.646
!MESSAGE Error retrieving "plugins/org.eclipse.cdt.core.win32_3.1.0.200602221446.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/callisto/staging/plugins/org.eclipse.cdt.core.win32_3.1.0.200602221446.jar.]
!STACK 0

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 8 1 2006-03-06 00:34:52.137
!MESSAGE

ok, never mind about the JDT APT error message ... that was a standard message in 
in the log when running 1.4.2, and I just read too fast. And, the relevent message was as in previous comments. 

So ... am I missing a feature to pull/copy?

ok, never mind about the JDT APT error message ... that was a standard message in 
in the log when running 1.4.2, and I just read too fast. And, the relevent message was as in previous comments. 

So ... am I missing a feature to pull/copy?

Yes, you are missing the org.eclipse.cdt.core.win32_3.1.0.200602211446.jar file. It is platform specific to win32. We have one such jar file for each platform. My guess is that, yes, you are only picking up the linux one in your mirror magicry :(.

Yes, I have confirmed running the update mirror command on windows does 
"pull down" org.eclipse.cdt.core.win32_3.1.0.200602221446.jar 


Pascal ... since you added yourself to this bug :) ... does this sound right to you? A quick of the update's "mirror" command? Is there some secret way to spec the platform dependancies? Some trick to specify "all" option to mirror command?

And, I have confirmed that "manually" copying rg.eclipse.cdt.core.win32_3.1.0.200602221446.jar

to the callisto plugin directory allowed CDT update to work fine. 

To get all the other platforms, for now, I'll "mannually" copy all of 
.../tools/cdt/releases/3.1.0/plugins
to the callisto plugins directory. 

We'll see if the "update script" problem can be fixed/understood as we go.

I've opened bug 131252 to track the general issue of the "mirror" command being platform sensitive, and consider this one-time problem for CDT to be resolved. 



*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 131252 ***
